title: Survival Game Project
description: A template for survival games with crafting, resource gathering, base building, and threat management. Includes pipelines for resources, crafting recipes, threats, and world systems.

decks.name: Resources
decks.description: Gatherable materials from the world. Add a resource card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Wood

Basic building material gathered from trees.

**Gather Method:** Chop trees with axe
**Stack Size:** 50
**Respawn:** Trees regrow in 10 minutes
**Used In:** Most basic crafting recipes

This card has the **#basic** tag to mark it as starter content. Use progression tags to organize when players encounter resources.

> **Journey Note:** Resource cards use journeys to create all the tasks needed: gathering mechanics, item icon, sound effects, and placement in the world.

Iron Ore

Metal ore found in caves and cliffs.

**Gather Method:** Mine with pickaxe
**Stack Size:** 30
**Locations:** Underground caves, mountain areas
**Used In:** Advanced tools and weapons

**Requires:** Stone Pickaxe to harvest

Stone

Basic building material gathered from rocks.

**Gather Method:** Mine with pickaxe
**Stack Size:** 50
**Used In:** Tools, structures, weapon crafting

**Consider:** How common should stone be? Should it respawn?

Plant Fiber

Flexible material for crafting ropes and cloth.

**Gather Method:** Harvest from bushes by hand
**Stack Size:** 100
**Used In:** Clothing, bags, basic structures

**Consider:** Should fiber be renewable? Farming vs gathering?

decks.name: Crafting Recipes
decks.description: Items players can craft from resources. Add a recipe card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Stone Axe

Basic tool for chopping trees faster.

**Recipe:** 5 Wood + 3 Stone
**Durability:** 100 uses
**Effect:** Chop trees 2x faster than bare hands
**Crafted At:** Inventory (no workbench needed)

> **Effort Tip:** This card has 3 effort points. Simple items are quick to add, but items with special mechanics (durability, enchantments) need more work.

Campfire

Cooking station and light source.

**Recipe:** 10 Wood + 5 Stone
**Function:** Cook food, provide warmth and light
**Durability:** Permanent (needs fuel to stay lit)
**Fuel:** Burns 1 wood per minute

Bandage

Basic healing item crafted from fiber.

**Recipe:** 5 Plant Fiber
**Function:** Restores health over time
**Durability:** Single use

**Consider:** How much should it heal? Should crafting time matter?

decks.name: Threats
decks.description: Dangers that challenge player survival (enemies, weather, hunger). Add a threat card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Wolf Pack

Aggressive predators that hunt at night.

**Behavior:** Pack of 2-4 wolves that chase and surround player
**Damage:** 15 per bite
**HP:** 40 per wolf
**Loot:** Meat, hide
**Spawn:** Forest biomes, nighttime

**Priority Note:** Marked 'a' because you need at least one threat to test your survival mechanics!

Hunger System

Player must eat regularly to survive.

**Mechanics:**
- Hunger drains slowly over time
- At 0 hunger, player starts losing health
- Food items restore hunger
- Different foods restore different amounts

This is a core survival mechanic, not a repeatable asset, so it has manually-created sub-cards instead of using a journey.

Cold/Temperature System

Player must manage body temperature.

**Mechanics:**
- Temperature drops at night and in winter
- Standing near fire increases temperature
- Warm clothing provides insulation
- At freezing, player loses health slowly

**Consider:** How punishing should cold be? Balance risk vs reward for night exploration.

decks.name: World Systems
decks.description: Environmental systems and biomes. Each is a unique system requiring custom implementation.

cards.content:
Day/Night Cycle

Time progression affecting gameplay.

**Day Length:** 20 minutes real-time (10 min day, 10 min night)
**Effects:**
- Night: Reduced visibility, more dangerous enemies spawn
- Day: Safe, easier resource gathering
**Temperature:** Colder at night, warmer at day

**Linked Systems:** Temperature, Enemy Spawning, Visibility

Weather System

Dynamic weather affecting survival.

**Weather Types:** Clear, Rain, Snow, Storm
**Effects:**
- Rain: Wets player (risk of cold), harder to light fires
- Snow: Slows movement, drains temperature faster  
- Storm: High danger, reduced visibility

**Frequency:** Weather changes every 15-30 minutes

decks.name: Design Notes
decks.description: Design documentation, meeting notes, and playtesting findings. Use this deck to capture design decisions and their rationale.

cards.content:
Design Meeting: Threat Escalation

**Date:** Sprint 2
**Attendees:** Game Designer, AI Programmer

**Decisions:**
- Early game: environmental threats (hunger, cold)
- Mid game: wildlife threats increase
- Late game: weather events and rare boss creatures

**Rationale:** Gradual threat escalation maintains tension throughout playthrough.

Playtesting Notes: Crafting Progression

**Session:** Week 4 playtest
**Findings:**
- Players enjoyed discovering recipes
- Confusion about which resources unlock which tiers

**Changes:** Added crafting tech tree UI, recipe hints system.
